Please enable accessibility service to read and identify the positions of text elements and image elements on the screen to extract their text content. On the settings page, select this app and enable accessibility permission

For PharaSnap to capture and copy text on the screen. It need access to Accessibility service to read text block on screen and as well identify images block are placed on the screen for image-to-text recognition. No personal data is collected and shared to third parties
When using this tool a floating widget displayed over the screen. Please grant permission to draw over other apps. Don\'t worry you can stop the widget when not in use.

PharaSnap can help you copy text on the screen even on places where you don\'t have the facility directly copy text to clipboard. PharaSnap can even capture text on images without ever leaving the app

To make this tool easily accessible to use it is recommended to add the quick settings shortcut in your notification panel. Open your notification panel, in the top section (quick settings panel) then tap to customize the panel and add the shortcut tile provided by this app to the active area. Drag and place it on a convenient place \n\nAnother way to open the widget is by long pressing the app launch icon which prompt you open the widget.

When capturing text there are two modes, 
1) Text mode where you simply tap on text element on screen to capture (this could be button, label or multiline paragraph). 

2) Image mode uses text recognition OCR (for now only support latin characters including english) to capture text on images. 
When switching to Image mode the app request screen capture session in order to visually see the image content on the screen. (Accessibility Service does not project graphical images on the screen for your Android version). Screen capturing would automatically turn off in 7 seconds after you leave Image mode 

You can toggle between the two modes on left-most button on the widget.

Once you tap on the text on screen (not drag and select) it would get highlighted and you can select multiple selections at once. By default all text from all selected text blocks will be automatically copied to clipboard once you exit or collapse the floating widget. Also you can use text selection editor to only select the required text from the text blocks when you tap on the yellow bar.
You can also view your last copied items in the recent list from the floating widget itself. You can remove individual items or clear the list altogether.
This is an app developed by single person. If love this app useful I would like to hear your feedback and thoughts.
